cellery

Class CellArray1D

  • java.lang.Object
    • cellery.CellArray1D

  • public class CellArray1D
extends java.lang.Object
    CellArray1D is a 1-d array of Cell objects which can kill or resurrect Cells and retrieve neighborhoods about individual Cells.
    Author:
    Zach Tidwell

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int length
      the number of Cells in this.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CellArray1D(int[] intArray)
      Instantiates a CellArray1D from an int array with the standard radial topology of the fineness granularity.
      CellArray1D(int[] intArray, Topology1D topo)
      Instantiates a CellArray1D from an array of integers.
      CellArray1D(int length, Topology1D topo)
      Instantiates a CellArray1D of length containing only dead Cells.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Cell getCell(int i)
      Retrieves the Cell at position i.
      int getNeighborhood(int i)
      Gets the neighborhood that is specified by this topology
      Topology1D getTopology()
      Retrieve the Topology of this
      void killCell(int i)
      Kills the Cell at position i
      int leftOf(int i, int r)
      Retrieves the number of living Cells in a region of radius r to the left of the Cell at position i
      int livingCells()
      Computes the number of living Cells in this.
      int radial(int i, int r)
      Retrieves the CellArray1D containing the Cells about the i-th Cell in a symmetric neighborhood of radius r.
      void reviveCell(int i)
      Revives the Cell at position i.
      int rightOf(int i, int r)
      Retrieves the number of living Cells in a region of radius r to the right of the Cell at position i
      int[] toBinaryArray()
      Gives an array of binary Values corresponding to the Cells in this.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Translates this into a String containing binary integers representing the Cell states of this.

    • Method Detail

      • leftOf

        public int leftOf(int i,
         int r)
        Retrieves the number of living Cells in a region of radius r to the left of the Cell at position i
        Parameters:
        i - the position of the Cell
        r - the radius of the left-hand region

      • rightOf

        public int rightOf(int i,
          int r)
        Retrieves the number of living Cells in a region of radius r to the right of the Cell at position i
        Parameters:
        i - the position of the Cell
        r - the radius of the right-hand region

      • radial

        public int radial(int i,
         int r)
        Retrieves the CellArray1D containing the Cells about the i-th Cell in a symmetric neighborhood of radius r.
        Parameters:
        i - the index of the center of the neighborhood
        r - the radius of the neighborhood
        Returns:
        CellArray containing the neighboring cells.

      • getNeighborhood

        public int getNeighborhood(int i)
        Gets the neighborhood that is specified by this topology
        Parameters:
        i - the index of the neighborhood center
        Returns:
        the number of living Cells in this neighborhood

      • getTopology

        public Topology1D getTopology()
        Retrieve the Topology of this
        Returns:
        the Topology

      • toBinaryArray

        public int[] toBinaryArray()
        Gives an array of binary Values corresponding to the Cells in this. 1 indicates that the Cell is alive and 0 indicates that it is dead.
        Returns:
        the binary array represented the states of Cells in this

      • livingCells

        public int livingCells()
        Computes the number of living Cells in this.
        Returns:
        the number of living cells in this.
